description: Students examine contemporary approaches to classical issues in ethics and theory of value: the nature of moral judgments; theories of moral obligation and value; the concept of moral responsibility; and the relation of morality to science, religion, and law. May be repeated if topics are different. Prerequisites: two courses in philosophy, one of which must be either 235 or 236 or permission of the department chair; completion of BTS-T or permission of instructor..
name: Sem: Eth/Theory/Value
notes: Prerequisite: completion of BTS-T or permission of instructor. Open only to seniors and juniors during web registration.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: two courses in philosophy, one of which must be either 235 or 236 or permission of the department chair; completion of BTS-T or permission of instructor..
title: Seminar in Ethics and Theory of Value
